issue.title: Positive Feedback ❤️
issue.body: Everyone loves to read positive feedback; feel free to use this issue as a place to jot down the things you enjoy about Zed.  If you want to give permission to the Zed team to use your comment in promotional content ([Zed Twitter](https://twitter.com/zeddotdev), [zed.dev](https://zed.dev), etc.), place a 🚀 reaction on your post.

comment.body: I'm delighted to try out Zed. It worked out of the box for me with rust-analyzer, all the defaults and keys seem sane to me. And most importantly - blazingly fast, even faster than Sublime Text. Worked with Zed a few days so far, got zero crashes or bugs, even though this is not a publicly released product. Amazing job, team! I hope you'll find a way to make this project sustainable (and would be willing to do my part, too). 🚀

issue.title: www.jetblue.com - site is not usable
issue.body:
**URL**: https://www.jetblue.com/ **Browser / Version**: Firefox 107.0 **Operating System**: Mac OS X 10.15 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes Safari **Problem type**: Site is not usable **Description**: Page not loading correctly **Steps to Reproduce**: Ordering a ticket through JetBlue, there is a screen appears that is asking to wait for tickets to generate. It shows an animation. Tickets never get generated, and it times out, the session gets lost eventually. I tried twice, same result - failure to generate tickets. Then tried with Safari (Version 16.1 (17614.2.9.1.13, 17614)), and the "generating tickets" page resolved within about a minute. All worked.
Browser Configuration
  • None
_From [webcompat.com](https://webcompat.com/) with ❤️_

issue.title: December 2022 Meetup Registration
issue.body:
# Happy December!

It's almost time for the December Rust Gamedev Meetup! From now on, I'm hoping to make monthly issues on this repo to find people who want to show off what they've been doing. If you have something cool, comment with the template below 🚀 

## Template

```
Project:

Discord username:

Estimated time:
```

![meetup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14791619/206266628-715242b9-4956-4bd2-8932-bc899dedce10.png)

comment.body:
Project: [Rusty Vangers](https://vange.rs/)
Discord username: kvark#9787
Estimated time: 5-15 minutes (flexible)

pull_request.title: Add ValidationFlags::BINDINGS
pull_request.body:
Part of #2154

A few things to think about here:
  1. Is the scope of the flag chosen soundly? I was considering `INTERFACE` first, but it could be considered too wide of a scope.
  2. Can this be released as a patch? I.e. is adding a bitflag a breaking change?

issue.title: Make validation truly optional
issue.body:
Currently, even with empty validation flags, the validator complains about things that aren't required to produce the module info. For example, it requires the `@group` and `@binding` to be present, unconditionally, on resources. This doesn't affect construction of `ModuleInfo` and should be gated behind a flag. Moreover, documentation of `--validation` option in naga-cli says:
>   --validate        bitmask of the ValidationFlags to be used, use 0 to disable validation

pull_request.title: n40: rusty vangers update
pull_request.body: Part of #1203

issue.title: Make wgpu-hal resources impl Copy
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
#3191 describes it well enough.
By-move semantics doesn't really help anything in wgpu-hal. Implementations are mostly caring about copyable handles, and lifetimes are up to the user.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Make `Api::Buffer`, `Api::Texture`, `Api::TextureView`, and `Api::Sampler` implement `Copy`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We can't make *everything* copy, e.g. bind groups clearly need to carry arrays of data.
But the selected types are probably safe to do.

**Additional context**

comment.body:
This wouldn't affect the users of wgpu, wgpu-native, or wgpu-core.
It would make wgpu-hal closer to the low level apis it abstracts over. And it could simplify some of the interaction between wgpu-core and wgpu-hal (less lifetimes to pass borrowed stuff).

Overall, it looks like wgpu-hal is *almost* able to do this. The benefit isn't that high, so we may as well not try pursuing it further.

pull_request.title: Make wgpu-hal resources copyable (Metal and GL only)
pull_request.body:

- [x] Run `cargo clippy`.

- [x] Add change to CHANGELOG.md. See simple instructions inside file.

**Connections**
Closes #3195

**Description**
See #3195

**Testing**
Examples.

issue.title: Manual refcounting on Metal

labels.name: area: ecosystem
labels.description: Help the connected projects grow and prosper

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In DX12 we have a lightweight abstraction over a Com pointer that copies the value without touching the refcount. This is done ... because we can, in wgpu-hal at least. Everything is unsafe, and wgpu-hal doesn't manage lifetimes, so there is very little point to do refcounting internally for every copy (of the object data).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Everything should basically store raw pointers to Metal objects, internally. We'd manually call `acquire`/`release` to control the object lifetime.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Possibly using the XxxRef objects, generated in metal-rs? Assuming they can be copied and not just borrowed.

**Additional context**
The backend already uses lightweight pointers as `BufferPtr`, `TexturePtr`, and `SamplerPtr`. I think we should just do it more aggressively in wgpu-hal's Metal backend.

Also, this isn't really a performance concern. The actual need here is to have `Api::Buffer` copyable at the API level. Same for textures and samplers. Whether or not Metal is the only blocker for this is an open question. WebGL may require non-copy semantics as well.

Now it's a bit of a blocker.

pull_request.title: Remove RayMip rendering
pull_request.body:
Writing this and re-implementing in wgpu (see #82) has been very challenging for me. Part of that challenge was due to the algorithm being "borrowed". Today, this path isn't available because we aren't even storing the data in a texture.
Also, now I have my own voxelized tracing path - #218. It's superior to the mipmapped one, and I'd like to focus on it.

issue.title: Positive Feedback ❤️
issue.body: Everyone loves to read positive feedback; feel free to use this issue as a place to jot down the things you enjoy about Zed.  If you want to give permission to the Zed team to use your comment in promotional content ([Zed Twitter](https://twitter.com/zeddotdev), [zed.dev](https://zed.dev), etc.), place a 🚀 reaction on your post.

comment.body: I'm delighted to try out Zed. It worked out of the box for me with rust-analyzer, all the defaults and keys seem sane to me. And most importantly - blazingly fast, even faster than Sublime Text. Worked with Zed a few days so far, got zero crashes or bugs, even though this is not a publicly released product. Amazing job, team! I hope you'll find a way to make this project sustainable (and would be willing to do my part, too). 🚀

issue.title: www.jetblue.com - site is not usable
issue.body:
**URL**: https://www.jetblue.com/ **Browser / Version**: Firefox 107.0 **Operating System**: Mac OS X 10.15 **Tested Another Browser**: Yes Safari **Problem type**: Site is not usable **Description**: Page not loading correctly **Steps to Reproduce**: Ordering a ticket through JetBlue, there is a screen appears that is asking to wait for tickets to generate. It shows an animation. Tickets never get generated, and it times out, the session gets lost eventually. I tried twice, same result - failure to generate tickets. Then tried with Safari (Version 16.1 (17614.2.9.1.13, 17614)), and the "generating tickets" page resolved within about a minute. All worked.
Browser Configuration
  • None
_From [webcompat.com](https://webcompat.com/) with ❤️_

pull_request.title: Add ValidationFlags::BINDINGS
pull_request.body:
Part of #2154

A few things to think about here:
  1. Is the scope of the flag chosen soundly? I was considering `INTERFACE` first, but it could be considered too wide of a scope.
  2. Can this be released as a patch? I.e. is adding a bitflag a breaking change?

issue.title: Make validation truly optional
issue.body:
Currently, even with empty validation flags, the validator complains about things that aren't required to produce the module info. For example, it requires the `@group` and `@binding` to be present, unconditionally, on resources. This doesn't affect construction of `ModuleInfo` and should be gated behind a flag. Moreover, documentation of `--validation` option in naga-cli says:
>   --validate        bitmask of the ValidationFlags to be used, use 0 to disable validation

pull_request.title: n40: rusty vangers update
pull_request.body: Part of #1203

issue.title: Make wgpu-hal resources impl Copy
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
#3191 describes it well enough.
By-move semantics doesn't really help anything in wgpu-hal. Implementations are mostly caring about copyable handles, and lifetimes are up to the user.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Make `Api::Buffer`, `Api::Texture`, `Api::TextureView`, and `Api::Sampler` implement `Copy`.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
We can't make *everything* copy, e.g. bind groups clearly need to carry arrays of data.
But the selected types are probably safe to do.

**Additional context**

comment.body:
This wouldn't affect the users of wgpu, wgpu-native, or wgpu-core.
It would make wgpu-hal closer to the low level apis it abstracts over. And it could simplify some of the interaction between wgpu-core and wgpu-hal (less lifetimes to pass borrowed stuff).

Overall, it looks like wgpu-hal is *almost* able to do this. The benefit isn't that high, so we may as well not try pursuing it further.

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

By-move semantics doesn't really help anything in wgpu-hal. Implementations are mostly caring about copyable handles, and lifetimes are up to the user.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Make `Api::Buffer`, `Api::Texture`, `Api::TextureView`, and `Api::Sampler` implement `Copy`.

issue.title: Manual refcounting on Metal

labels.name: area: ecosystem
labels.description: Help the connected projects grow and prosper

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
In DX12 we have a lightweight abstraction over a Com pointer that copies the value without touching the refcount. This is done ... because we can, in wgpu-hal at least. Everything is unsafe, and wgpu-hal doesn't manage lifetimes, so there is very little point to do refcounting internally for every copy (of the object data).

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Everything should basically store raw pointers to Metal objects, internally. We'd manually call `acquire`/`release` to control the object lifetime.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Possibly using the XxxRef objects, generated in metal-rs? Assuming they can be copied and not just borrowed.

**Additional context**
The backend already uses lightweight pointers as `BufferPtr`, `TexturePtr`, and `SamplerPtr`. I think we should just do it more aggressively in wgpu-hal's Metal backend.

Also, this isn't really a performance concern. The actual need here is to have `Api::Buffer` copyable at the API level. Same for textures and samplers. Whether or not Metal is the only blocker for this is an open question. WebGL may require non-copy semantics as well.

pull_request.title: Remove RayMip rendering
pull_request.body:
Writing this and re-implementing in wgpu (see #82) has been very challenging for me. Part of that challenge was due to the algorithm being "borrowed". Today, this path isn't available because we aren't even storing the data in a texture.
Also, now I have my own voxelized tracing path - #218. It's superior to the mipmapped one, and I'd like to focus on it.
